intro: Neea pycnantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved neea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes other shrubs and trees. Neea pycnantha is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
